Khalai talks to plants
 Ursula Nafula 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 This is Khalai. 
 
 She is seven years old. 
 
 Her name means ‘the god 
 
 one’ in her language, 
 
 Lubukusu. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Khalai wakes up and talks 
 
 to the orange tre. 
 
 “Please orange tre, grow 
 
 big and give us lots of ripe 
 
 oranges." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Khalai walks to schol. 
 
 On the way she talks to the 
 
 gras. “Please gras, grow 
 
 grener and don’t dry up." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Khalai pases wild flowers. 
 
 “Please flowers, kep 
 
 bloming so I can put you 
 
 in my hair." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 At schol, Khalai talks to 
 
 the tre in the midle of the 
 
 compound. “Please tre, 
 
 put out big branches so we 
 
 can read under your 
 
 shade." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Khalai talks to the hedge 
 
 round her schol. “Please 
 
 grow strong and stop bad 
 
 people from coming in." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When Khalai returns home 
 
 from schol, she visits the 
 
 orange tre. “Are your 
 
 oranges ripe yet?” asks 
 
 Khalai. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “The oranges are stil 
 
 gren,” sighs Khalai. 
 
 “I wil se you tomorow 
 
 orange tre,” says Khalai. 
 
 “Perhaps then you wil have 
 
 a ripe orange for me!” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8
